results.title: Joining in (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Pre School Child”.
Development from simple to more complicated forms of social play is gradual, and this film identifies six different stages. Also points out different ways in which adults may encourage and take part in children’s play.

results.title: Join the navy and see the world they say
results.creator_credit: Ron Baguley, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Inspired by his childhood hero, ‘Uncle Jack’, Ron Baguley enlisted in the Navy at the ripe age of 16. “Join the Navy and see the world they say!” In 1952, Ron was plucked from his job as a carpenter and thrown into a life at sea, serving initially in the Korean Conflict. Ron tracks his incredibly journey from a young recruit to a senior warrant officer.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Ron Baguley, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Join the Navy and see the world
results.creator_credit: David Higgins, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When he went to the cinemas, the newsreels would beckon David Higgins to ‘Join the Navy and see the world!’. And join the Navy he did, serving in the Mediterranean during World War II. He guides us through the bowels of the ship and the claustrophobic conditions therein. David also reflects on the life-shifting experience of war, how it changed his perspective on things and how little he knew at the time when he signed up.

results.title: Joi-Uchi = Rebellion (Cinemascope print)
results.creator_credit: Masaki Kobayashi, Tomoyuki Tanaka, Toshiro Mifune, Mifune Productions and Toho Kabushiki Kaisha
results.brief_description:
Isaburo is an aging swordsman loyal to the feudal system of Japanese society. His son, Yogoro is requested to marry his father’s overlord’s mistress, Ichi, with whom the lord has become displeased. Against his father’s wishes Yogoro agrees to the match, and falls in love with Ichi, who bears him a son. When the clan’s elder son dies, the lord sends for Ichi to return - but the family refuse to be parted. Supported by Isaburo, for whom life has renewed meaning, father and son join forces against the warlord, who orders the couple to commit suicide and then when they refuse, sends soldiers to execute them. Set in 1725 Japan, ‘Rebellion’ is an intriguing historical drama that pitches the samurai’s code of honour against his familial loyalties, reaching a typically bloody and beautifully choreographed finale.

Credits: Producer, Toshiro Mifune, Tomoyuki Tanaka ; director, Masaki Kobayashi ; writer, Shinobu Hashimoto ; photography, Kazuo Yamada ; music, Toru Takemitsu ; editing, Hisashi Sagara
Cast: Toshiro Mifune, Takeshi Kato, Yoko Tsukasa, Tatsuya Nakadai, Tatsuyoshi Ebara, Michiko Otsuka.

results.title: Johura
results.creator_credit: Barkat Ullah, Gian Manara, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service, BTV Bangladesh and Asian Broadcasting Union
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “A Day in the Life of a Woman”.
Johura lives on an island on a river in Bangladesh with her husband and small children. They are very poor and, to supplement their income, Johura makes an arduous journey every day into Dakkha where she works as a machinist in a textile factory. Her life is hard, yet she strives to educate her own children as well as those of the neighbouring shanties. Franca Arena introduces her story.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Barkat Ullah, Gian Manara, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service, BTV Bangladesh and Asian Broadcasting Union

results.title: Johnson and friends. - Volume 3.
results.brief_description: Johnson, the fearless pink elephant, leads his friends in six new stories: The toys organise a surprise “Birthday party” for Johnson and must work together save their friend “Alfred” from being thrown away. “Battle of the bed”: the whole room and all the toys are at war. The toys become suspicious of themselves as McDuff loses her medal in “A case of trust.” Johnson wants to go to hospital with Michael in “Blast off” but how will he manage it? “The concert”: there was a show under the bed, it was starting that night and all the toys had stagefright!

results.title: Johnson and friends. - Volume 1.
results.brief_description: Johnson, a courageous pink elephant, leads his friends on a daring adventure into the darkness under Michael’s bed. They stumble upon Alfred, a gruff hot water bottle lurking in the shadows. McDuff, the cheeky concertina, squeals in surprise as Diesel the dump truck and Squeaky the battered robot head for safety. Michael’s cluttered bedroom is the setting for the captivating series of adventures and misadventures which draw together this irrepressible band of toys.

results.title: Johnson & Friends
results.brief_description: Johnson and Friends is one of the most beloved Australian kids shows, airing on the ABC in the perfect timeslot between school and dinner. It featured toys that came to life and starred ACMI CEO Katrina Sedgwick as McDuff.

constellations_other.name: Flipping through the evolution of animation
constellations_other.description: Animation has come a long way since flip books were popular. These optical toys gave the illusion of movement, but now whole films and special effects are animated entirely through computers.

constellations_other.name: Australian TV in the 1990s
constellations_other.description: In the 1990s, Australians and Australian culture was changing: so too were the representations of it on television.

recommendations.quote: Before Katrina Sedgwick landed the lead role at ACMI, she starred in a range of iconic TV shows and movies, including The Last Wave (1977) and E Street (1989). But our favourite role of Katrina's is the cheeky concertina McDuff in Johnson and Friends (1990–95).

results.description: Johnson and Friends is an Australian children’s television programme broadcast on ABC from 12 November 1990 to 25 December 1995. It was produced by Film Australia and lasted seven seasons. In the UK it was shown in the 1993 on TCC, CBBC, and then on UK Living’s Tiny Living strand for under-fives. It was aired in the United States as a segment on the Fox Cubhouse, an educational children’s program on Fox, from 1993 to 1996.
description_for_label: Johnson and Friends is an Australian children’s television programme broadcast on ABC from 12 November 1990 to 25 December 1995. It was produced by Film Australia and lasted seven seasons. In the UK it was shown in the 1993 on TCC, CBBC, and then on UK Living’s Tiny Living strand for under-fives. It was aired in the United States as a segment on the Fox Cubhouse, an educational children’s program on Fox, from 1993 to 1996.
